A layered\, morally confounding examination of the dangers of labeling people/groups as evil without full context\, told through the guise of a revenge tale. Compelling characters\, creative medium-specific storytelling\, top notch presentation\, passable gameplay with generally satisfying stealth and combat\, and unfortunately the usual AAA \"oh no the door is locked\" padding that could certainly have been tightened up.I saw the first game as a brutal examination of morally gray actions and consequences\, not once painting the protagonist as a hero or villain. I felt that the second ran with those ideas even more so. It builds upon the first game's themes in risky\, powerful ways\, but never upends the player's role in sorting through complex moral conundrum's for themselves.… Expand
